title: Repent! Undercover New Hampshire cops nab cell ban violators
text:
By HOLLY RAMER
Associated Press CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - Michelle Tetreault's (TAY'-trohz) daughter didn't know what "repent" meant when she spotted a man with a sign warning "Repent! The end is near!" But the Somersworth, New Hampshire, girl is plenty sorry now that her mom is facing a $124 traffic ticket for using her cellphone to snap a picture of the man.
Moments after Tetreault took the picture, she was pulled over. She was told the man with the sign was an undercover officer and ticketed for using a cellphone while driving. That's illegal in New Hampshire.
As states ban text messaging and using hand-held phones for drivers, police departments nationwide are getting creative. Tetreault calls it a "stinky way" to enforce the law, but Somersworth police Chief Dean Crombie says he has an obligation to keep the city safe.
